New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 6-3 victory over the New York Yankees
Jazz Chisholm Jr. stole two bases and scored on a fielder's choice to give the Yankees a 3-2 lead in the top of the 10th
Gavin Lux walked and went to second on Tommy Edman's infield single, setting up the winning grand slam
Pre-Game Insights: The World Series between the two storied franchises was highly anticipated
Freddie Freeman, hobbled by a badly sprained ankle, was a key player to watch
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed his excitement and gratitude after hitting the game-ending grand slam
The Dodgers' manager was thrilled with the team's resilience and ability to come back from a 3-2 deficit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the third straight World Series opener to go into extra innings
Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam was reminiscent of Kirk Gibson's famous home run in the 1988 World Series
Others: The game featured several notable performances, including Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam and Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s two stolen bases
